meanings.definition: A horizontal beam or bar across a window or door.
meanings.sent1: The transoms above the doors let in light.
meanings.sent2: She painted the transoms to match the window frames.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to balance on the transoms above the doors.
meanings.sent4: The transoms acted as bridges between the rooms, connecting them visually.
meanings.sent5: The colorful transoms added a touch of elegance to the plain doors.

meanings.definition: A small window above a door or larger window.
meanings.sent1: The old house had beautiful stained glass transoms above each door.
meanings.sent2: He peeked through the transoms to see who was at the door.
meanings.sent3: The birds built a nest on the transoms, creating a cozy spot.
meanings.sent4: The transoms resembled tiny skylights, letting in a sliver of sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The rain pattered softly on the glass transoms during the storm.

meanings.definition: A horizontal crossbar in a window frame.
meanings.sent1: She carefully cleaned the metal transoms in the window frames.
meanings.sent2: The transoms helped hold the window panes in place.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel balanced precariously on the thin transoms outside.
meanings.sent4: The transoms divided the view outside into neat sections.
meanings.sent5: The delicate lace curtains fluttered in the breeze coming through the transoms.
